Text.Value: Our options are starting to look decidedly limited.
We're short on options, I fear.
Chk. Our choices are limited.
We're hardly awash with options right now.
Hells - we've run out of options.
Options are pretty thin on the ground.
I do not know what other options we have.
Options seem painfully limited, I must admit.
We did right to spit the illithid's offer back in its slippery visage. You have a backup plan, yes?
We have left ourselves few options.
Looks like we're out of options...
Perhaps it's time we used the hammer and freed the gith prince?
Time to loosen the chains of the githyanki prince, perhaps.
It's time. We must break Prince Orpheus free.
Is there no other way? Must the false prince go free for us to end the Netherbrain?
Time to unleash Orpheus, then?
Get the Hammer ready - we need to break the githyanki prince free.
We need to break him out.
We have the hammer. And I'm sure the gith prince would be glad to stretch his legs.
We shall have to free him.
Methinks we have to wake the sleeping Prince. But who shall do the smooching?
We retrieved that hammer for a reason. Let us free Prince Orpheus.
We have the hammer - we can free Orpheus.
We still have the tadpole and we still have Orpheus. I'm just saying...
The solution is clear, if repellent. We must assimilate Orpheus...
Mother Gith, forgive me. If we're to end the Grand Design, the prince must be consumed.
If the Grand Design is to be stopped, we must consume the false prince. There is no other way.
As long as Orpheus is bound, we're helpless. We have to assimilate him...
We still have the tadpole. Failing all else, we can assimilate Orpheus.
We still have the tadpole. And... we can still assimilate Orpheus.
We have the tadpole - we have the prince. It may have to be the Emperor's plan after all.
We still have the means of assimilating Orpheus.
Are we truly to feed on the gith princeling as if he were some fest-day goat?
Consume the tadpole. Evolve. Take the gith's power... and his brain.
We still have the tadpole - we could become illithid and assimilate Orpheus.
I'm sure he'll be thrilled we're freeing him now, in the middle of this.
I doubt we'll get much in the way of gratitude. Only one way to find out.
Orpheus, my prince. It is your time.
Tsk'va. To free the false prince - is there no other way?
Let's hope he's in a friendly mood.
I just hope he'll be receptive to us...
Hope he's happy to see us.
A githyanki noble, imprisoned for aeons. He'll be beside himself with good humour, I'm sure.
I just hope he is amenable.
I hope he is not angry about the aeons of imprisonment. I have been a statue - it is not so bad.
Awakening in the midst of an apocalypse should invigorate him.
Wouldn't expect him to be very friendly after an aeon of captivity.
At the risk of being stereotyped, we could still drain Orpheus...
Orpheus can't help us so long as he's chained.
There's - there's no other way. If the Netherbrain is to die, the True Heir must be consumed...
If the Grand Design is to be stopped, the traitor prince must be consumed. There is no other way.
As long as Orpheus is bound, we're helpless. We'll have to do the unthinkable...
Orpheus will be of no use, so long as he's chained.
But we don't have any way to free Orpheus.
We have no means to free the prince - but you still have the means to use his power.
And we are without the means to free Orpheus.
Are we truly to feed on the gith princeling as if he were some fest-day goat?
We have no means to evolve, and no means to free the gith. This is the end.
And as long as Orpheus is chained, he can't help us.

Synopsis: Player has rejected Emperor and doesn't have the means to free Orpheus, but knows that in order to defeat the Netherbrain they need to a) be illithid to wield the stones to their full effect, and b) assimilate Orpheus' power. If the player has the supreme tadpole, they can still assimilate Orpheus.
